bibl.title: George Daly v. J.H. McGraw. Order Granting Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.ab: In the District Court holding terms at Seattle, King County, Washington Territory.
In the Matter of the Application of George R. Daily, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
div1.p: On reading and filing the petition of George R. Daly, duly signed and verified whereby it appears that he is illegally imprisoned and restrained of his liberty, by J.H. McGraw, Sheriff of King County, W.T. at the City of Seattle, in the County of King, in the Territory of Washington, in the county jail of said county and stating wherein the illegality consists from which it appears to me that a Writ of Habeas Corpus ought to issue, it is ordered that a writ of Habeas Corpus issue out of and under the seal of the District Court of the Third Judicial District of the Territory of Washington holding terms at the city of Seattle in and for the County of King, directed to the said J.H. McGraw commanding him to have the body of the said George R. Daily before me at my the chambers of said court in the court hose in the said city of Seattle on the 17th dat of March 1884, at o'clock, A.M. of that day to do and recieve what shall then and there be considered and ordered concerning the said George R. Daily, together with the time and cause of his detention, and that he have then and there the said Writ.
div1.ab: Dated on the 16 day of March 1884
NO. 3748 In the District Court 3d Judicial District, holding terms at Seattle Washington Territory.
In the matter of the application of George E Daily granting of Plaintiff vs Habeas Corpus defendant
Anders filed March 16 1884 Jame Seavey clerk. By James P Ludlow Deputy.
